intro: Tanacetopsis subsimilis, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer and are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Tanacetopsis subsimilis is valued for its aromatic compounds and potential anti-inflammatory effects.
